articles.title: Gunman Kills 5 People in Midtown Manhattan Skyscraper, Including Himself
articles.description: A gunman opened fire in a Midtown Manhattan office building, killing four people and himself. The shooter, identified as 27-year-old Shane Tamura from Las Vegas, reportedly targeted the NFL's corporate offices. He had a concealed carry license in Nevada and left a suicide note expressing grievances with the NFL and mentioning a diagnosis of CTE, a brain disease linked to head trauma.

articles.title: Russian Airstrikes Hit Prison in Ukraine, Killing 17 People
articles.description: Russian airstrikes targeted a prison in Zaporizhzhia, Ukraine, resulting in 17 deaths and 42 injuries. Additionally, a hospital in the Dnipro region was struck, killing three people, including a pregnant woman. These attacks coincide with President Trump's expedited deadline for Russia to agree to a ceasefire, moving it from 50 days to approximately 10 or 12 days.

articles.title: Senate Confirms New CDC Director Susan Monarez
articles.description: The Senate confirmed Susan Monarez, a health scientist and longtime civil servant, as the new director of the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC). Monarez is the first CDC director to be confirmed by the Senate under a law passed in 2023 and the first to serve without a medical degree in over 70 years. The confirmation vote was 51-47, along party lines.
